Module 7: Basic visualization using Matplotlib and Seaborn

* Introduction:
	+ Explanation of why visualization is important for data analysis in the banking industry
	+ Overview of different types of visualization commonly used in the banking industry, such as bar charts, line charts, and scatterplots
	+ Explanation of how Python can be used to create basic visualizations using the Matplotlib and Seaborn libraries

	+ Explanation of how visualization is a crucial part of many banking tasks, such as risk analysis, fraud detection, and market analysis
	+ Overview of how Python can be used to create basic visualizations quickly and easily, allowing for more effective data analysis and communication

	+ Overview of the Matplotlib and Seaborn libraries for creating visualizations in Python

	+ Customizing visualizations, such as adding titles, labels, and legends, using Matplotlib and Seaborn

	+ Overview of how to customize visualizations using Matplotlib and Seaborn

Overall, this module will provide learners with practical skills for creating basic visualizations using Python, with a specific focus on their applications in the banking industry. Learners will come away from this module with an understanding of how to use Matplotlib and Seaborn to create effective visualizations, customize visualizations to meet specific needs, and communicate insights effectively using visualizations.
